content.introduction: Comma is used in return statement. When comma is used in a return statement it can easily be misread as a semicolon. For example in the code below the value of 'b' is returned if the condition is true, but it is easy to think that 'a+1' is returned:\012    if (x)\012        return a + 1,\012    b++;\012However it can be useful to use comma in macros. Cppcheck does not warn when such a macro is then used in a return statement, it is less likely such code is misunderstood.
